title: Concentration of viruses from wastewater influent using organic flocculation (PEG)
title_html: Concentration of viruses from wastewater influent using organic flocculation (PEG)

protocol.title: Concentration of viruses from wastewater influent using organic flocculation (PEG)
protocol.title_html: Concentration of viruses from wastewater influent using organic flocculation (PEG)

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description: Remove chosen samples from freezer storage, and thaw at 4°C. This should take about five hours for a 50 mL conical tube, and samples should not be placed at 4°C longer than 24 hrs prior to processing. Record the sample’s volume.

source.body: Follow safe biosafety practices throughout. Samples should never be opened outside the biosafety cabinet (BSC). Bring the centrifuge rotor to the BSC before opening.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description:
Load samples into centrifuge rotor, ensuring that samples are balanced. Centrifuge at
to remove suspended solids.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description: Remove rotor from centrifuge and open it in the BSC. Pipette off about 40mL of supernatant, avoiding the solid pellet, into a new 50mL falcon tube.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description:
Add
/
PEG8000 and
NaCl to each sample and shake to mix. The PEG8000 may clump together, so gentle vortexing may be applied.

source.body: In order to determine the correct mass of PEG8000 and NaCl to add, calculate mass based on the sample volume.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description:
Incubate sample at
overnight.

source.body: If it is important to complete concentration in a single day incubation may be shortened to no less than 4 hours, however overnight incubation produces the best results.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description:
Individually spike each sample with
BCoV stock. Pipet the spike directly into the samples. Gently vortex to mix and allow to equilibrate
for
.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description:
Remove sample from 4°C the next morning. Load samples into centrifuge rotor, ensuring that samples are balanced. Centrifuge at
.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description: Remove samples from the rotor, and remove and discard ~20mL of sample. Wash the sides of the tube with the remaining supernatant.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description:
Centrifuge again at
.

source.title: Concentrate: 3 hours on day 1 and 1 hour on day 2 for 8 samples

source.description:
RNA extraction is performed using the Qiagen AllPrep PowerViral Kit.
Before starting:
Prepare Solution PM1/β-ME: Warm Solution PM1 at
for
prior to use to dissolve precipitates. Use Solution PM1 while still warm. Shake to mix before using.
Add β-ME to Solution PM1 to produce a mixture of Solution PM1/β-ME with a final β-ME concentration of 10 μl/ml (
of β-ME with
warm PM1 per sample). The mixture of Solution PM1/β-ME loses its effectiveness over time, so prepare a fresh batch each time you use the kit. You will need
of the Solution PM1/β-ME mixture per prep.

Pipet
of viral concentrate into a PowerBead Tube, Glass 0.1 mm. Include one extraction blank per set of extractions.

Add
of the Solution PM1/β-ME mixture to the PowerBead Tube.

Secure the bead tubes horizontally to a Vortex Adapter (cat. no. 13000-V1-24). The tube caps should be pointing toward the center of the adapter. Vortex at maximum speed for
in the BSC.

Centrifuge at
at room temperature. Transfer the supernatant to a clean 2 ml Collection Tube.

source.body: Stick the pipet tip down into the beads to pipet out all of the supernatant- it is okay if you get some beads because they will be centrifuged into a pellet in the following steps.

source.description:
Add
of Solution IRS and vortex briefly to mix. Incubate at
or on ice for
.

source.body: IRS is the inhibitor removal solution- this is a really important step!

source.description:
Centrifuge at
. Avoiding the pellet, transfer the supernatant to a clean 2.2 ml Collection Tube. Do not transfer more than
.

source.body: If you have access to a QIAcube, this is where the QIAcube Connect protocol begins.

source.description:
Add
each of Solution PM3 and Solution PM4 to each tube. Vortex briefly to mix.

Load
of supernatant into an MB Spin Column and centrifuge at
. Discard the flow through and repeat until all the supernatant has been loaded onto the MB Spin Column.

Shake to mix Solution PM5 and add
to the MB Spin Column. Centrifuge at
.

Discard flow-through. Add
of Solution PM4. Centrifuge at
.

Discard flow-through and Centrifuge at
to remove residual buffer.
Place the MB Spin Column in a clean 2 ml Collection Tube.

Add
of RNase-Free Water to the center of the MB Spin Column membrane. Incubate for
at room temperature. Pipet directly onto white membrane using a REACH pipet tip if needed.

Centrifuge at
. Discard the MB Spin Column. The DNA/RNA is now ready for downstream applications. Proceed with inhibitor removal immediately before storing DNA/RNA for future use.

Place one column into one collection tube for each sample you need and add
of Prep solution to each column.

Spin at
; discard collection tube with flow through.
Put column into a labeled 1.5mL LoBind tube.

Add ~
of RNA/DNA extract to each column.

Spin at
.

Use cleaned extract for Nanodrop, Qubit, or RT, and store at
until analysis.

Transfer the resuspended pellet to a 1mL cryotube and store at
.

description:
This SOP describes pre-analytical procedures to be followed for the isolation and identification of SARS-CoV-2 RNA in influent wastewater samples from wastewater treatment plants. PEG precipitation is used to concentrate viruses in the samples. The concentrated pellet is recovered and resuspended to be utilized for the next steps of the protocol. Bovine coronavirus is used as a recovery control for the concentration step. The RNA extraction is acheived using a commercial kit and an inhibitor removal kit is used to remove inhibitors that were co-extracted with the RNA. The RNA from this protocol can be used in droplet digital RT-PCR assays. A protocol for the dd-RTPCR assays is available from our group.

Biosafety Concerns

Concentration and extraction procedures that utilize raw samples must adhere to strict Biosafety Level 2+ procedures. These procedures should be performed in a dedicated room. Downstream products may be handled using standard laboratory safety guidelines.
